title: Expenses and benefits: credit, debit and charge cards

details.description: Tax and reporting rules for employers covering the cost of credit, debit and charge card payments
details.alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for credit, debit and charge cards

parts.title: Overview
parts.body:
As an employer covering the cost of credit, debit or charge card payments made by your employees, you have certain National Insurance and reporting obligations.

What’s included

What you have to pay and how you report this depends on how the card is used and what the employee purchases with it.

Different rules apply when buying certain items with a card, eg fuel for a company car, parking spaces or incidental overnight expenses.

parts.title: What's exempt
parts.body:
You don’t have to report or pay anything to HMRC if all the following apply:

  • you’ve authorised your employee to make the purchase
  • your employee makes it clear during the purchase that they’re acting on behalf of your business
  • your employee isn’t making a purchase where different rules apply (eg fuel for a company car, parking spaces or incidental overnight expenses)

parts.title: What to report and pay
parts.body:
If card charges aren’t exempt, you must report them to HMRC and may have to deduct and pay National Insurance on them.

This depends on how the credit or debit card is used, whether it’s clearly used on the employer’s behalf and what the employee purchases with it.

‘Used on the employer’s behalf’ means that the employee makes it clear to the supplier that they are making the purchase for your business.

The card is used on the employer’s behalf but without permission

Who uses the card What to do What to deduct or pay
Employees earning at a rate of less than £8,500 a year Report on form P9D, section B Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll
Employees earning at a rate of £8,500 or more a year Report on form P11D, section C Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll
Directors Report on form P11D, section C Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll

The card is used for business purchases but not clearly on behalf of the employer

Who uses the card What to do What to deduct or pay
Employees earning at a rate of less than £8,500 a year Report on form P9D, section B Nothing
Employees earning at a rate of £8,500 or more a year Report on form P11D, section C Nothing
Directors Report on form P11D, section C Nothing

The card is used for private purchases but not clearly on behalf of the employer

Who uses the card What to do What to deduct or pay
Employees earning at a rate of less than £8,500 a year Report on form P9D, section B Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll
Employees earning at a rate of £8,500 or more a year Report on form P11D, section C Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll
Directors Report on form P11D, section C Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll
